intro: Stenopetalum velutinum, commonly known as the velvetleaf sida, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves that give it its common name. Its flowers are small and typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters. Stenopetalum velutinum is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils.
